text: its mature form but it's not always all three components it can be 1 2 three like that different components to it can be on at a given point in time so the base position the primary profit mechanism is going to be being longest security and we're trying to play Direction that's the base position that is the primary profit mechanism for this trade then there are two additional components where we include options we have a ratio covered call and then we have cash secured puts this option component allows us to include a volatility and a Theta aspect to our position and it also allows us to dollar cost average into the underlying using a variable entry point so what that means is we might go out into the broad market and buy the shares outright that's a lot of times how it will start then we can use things like cash secured puts I referred to them as satellite positions what that means is the base position long equity and we will have cash secured puts but the cool part about cash secured puts is you can move them so if something starts rolling over and you're like well I still want to add into it but it seems like we're in a bit of a decline so I might roll the short puts so that I can get a better basis as I continue to scale into the underlying now the entire premise of this

text: different periods of time and the first thing that you'll notice is that the correlations are kind of all over the place right we can see 90-day correlations they tend to be pretty strong 60-day correlations tend to be strong but we can also see in shorter term time frames that the correlations can invert and actually offset one another and to help you know see this point a little more clearly if we grab two charts of this just so that you can see over a longer term time frame you can see that there's General alignment in terms of positive Drift But the composition of the moves is very different so the reason why this fits the portfolio well is because it's doesn't inherently add an a hedge but it does add a slightly different correlation to the portfolio and then this also allows me to capture the volatility of something like Bitcoin because again if we take a look first at ibit itself you can see that it's a really volatile ticker the current implied volatility in it is 63 as a raw number that's high now we don't have enough data on it yet because it's so new to give it an implied volatility percentile and an implied volatility rank so it'll be a little time before we actually have those metrics for ibit but on a gross dollar amount that's not an insignificant amount of volatility which is great to be able to trade that
